metadata.title: CVE-2016-3100 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
kinit in KDE Frameworks before 5.23.0 uses weak permissions (644) for/tmp/xauth-xxx-_y, which allows local users to obtain X11 cookies of otherusers and consequently capture keystrokes and possibly gain privileges byreading the file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3100` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kinit - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kinit package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1').
